qas.question: In what form is copper extracted?
From what types of mines is copper extracted?
What percentage of copper do the deposits have that are extracted?
What country was the top producer of copper in 2005?
What is the name of the process being considered in Arizona that allows copper to be recovered?
What types of mines is copper invisible?
What percentage of mercury do the deposits have that are extracted?
What village was the top producer of copper in 2005?
What is the name of the process being considered in Australia that allows copper to be recovered?

context: Most copper is mined or extracted as <a0_0><b5_0>copper sulfides<b5_0/><a0_0/> from large <a1_0><b6_0>open pit mines<b6_0/><a1_0/> in porphyry copper deposits that contain <a2_0><b7_0>0.4 to 1.0%<b7_0/> copper<a2_0/>. Examples include Chuquicamata in Chile, Bingham Canyon Mine in Utah, United States and El Chino Mine in New Mexico, United States. According to the British Geological Survey, in 2005, <a3_0><b8_0>Chile<b8_0/><a3_0/> was the top mine producer of copper with at least one-third world share followed by the United States, Indonesia and Peru. Copper can also be recovered through the <a4_0><b9_0>in-situ leach process<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Several sites in the state of Arizona are considered prime candidates for this method. The amount of copper in use is increasing and the quantity available is barely sufficient to allow all countries to reach developed world levels of usage.
